name: Ninja Remix
description: This is an updated version of Last Ninja 2: Back With a Vengeance. The differences are a short intro, some minor graphic changes and a remixed soundtrack. Gameplay is exactly the same as in Last Ninja 2.

shot.caption: Loading screen
First screen
Loading Screen.

Cinematics.
During a training session of the Inner Circle our hero and master Armakuni was enshrouded by a strange pulsating light.
Then he vanishes to reappear unconscious on a place drawn by silhouettes of what looked like musical instruments. The mission of the Shadow Warrior begins.

Level 1, "The Park": B?.
The ancient martial art weapon waits him at the last platform.

Level 1, "The Park": Nunchaku.
The mighty ninja searches for the second piece of the Nunchaku, the ancient weapon which hurt many people on their susceptibilities.

Level 1, "The Park": To the boat.
With the right key in his possession, Armakuni is almost fully prepared to face all dangers ahead of him.

Level 1, "The Park": The boat.
Are Armakuni's legs shaking...?

Level 1, "The Park": The wasps.
- Take them away from me!!
- Help, help!
Level 2, "The Street": Abbey Road.

Level 2, "The Street": Trafficking.
- (speaking very quietly) Pst... come here! Chestnuts! Hazelnuts! Pinions! 2€ a gram...
- Get out of my sight , you...
Level 2, "The Street": Searching for the Katana.

Level 2, "The Street": A fight near the store.
To access this place, you have to knock down the door with a Ninjutsu kick.

Level 2, "The Street": Drugstore.
- Gimme dat!

Level 2, "The Street": Eat's.
- Giivez thizz old chapz aye booze...
- Don't distract me boy, I'm on a secret mission.

Level 2, "The Street": On your marks, get set, GO!
- Scissors!
- Stone! (mua!)

Level 2, "The Street": Hot dog traffic.
- (mumbling) Gimme a dozen...

Level 3, "The Sewers": Manhole key.
Those stairs over there are misleading.

Level 3, "The Sewers": Only one.
Better to spare every piece of energy before finding the right door.

Level 3, "The Sewers": The Molotov Secret.
SPOILER ALERT! DON'T READ MORE!!
(this is the right torch to use the bottle)

Level 3, "The Sewers": Smell of barbecue.
- Believe me, I was forced to do this. As a ninja I don't agree doing this kind of actions just for the sake of the game... I'm sorr... (sobs)

Level 4, "The Basement": Labyrinth of boxes.
(Armakuni is getting hysterical)
- Someone help me, I'm getting out of air with this mask! Where's the exit? Help! Help!
Level 4, "The Basement": Hong Kong moment.

Level 4, "The Basement": Shadow Warrior.
The most important mission of this level - to steal a piece of chicken.

Level 4, "The Basement": A Caramelized Baked Chicken Leg.
- That was worth it!

Level 4, "The Basement": Fight for a chicken.
- Mine!

Level 4, "The Basement":Fight for a chicken II
These rail roads are electrified. Look out.
- Gimme it to me!

Level 4, "The Basement": Fight for a chicken III
- You shall not have the recipe!

Level 4, "The Basement": Spicy.
That bag over there has a special ingredient in it. You have to spice the chicken leg with it.

Level 4, "The Basement": The panther.
Armakuni has to feed the panther with the poisonous chicken leg...
- Do you mind? I'm having an emotional moment right now...

Level 4, "The Basement": Escaping to the Office.
(repeating Lalo Schifrin's Impossible Mission theme)

Level 5, "The Office": Cautious measures.
- Might be pretending, never know...

Level 5, "The Office": Working.
- Do you mind? Trying to concentrate myself here...

Level 5, "The Office": Escaping.
Not enough time to draw your sabre. Best strategy here is to run and unsheathe your weapon later.

Level 5, "The Office": Ventilator.
- How am I supposed to fight this thing?
Level 5, "The Office": A Dangerous fight.
Level 5, "The Office": Run for the roof.

Level 5, "The Office": Last enemy.
No pause after climbing the ladder. Better arm yourself quickly.

Level 6, "The House": Skylight.
(Landed from the skylight to start running for a place where I can draw my weapon peacefully.)

Level 6, "The House": Kitchen Elevator.
(Every place is defended by a bodyguard. I have to draw my weapon between rooms.)

Level 6, "The House": The rope.
(This rope will prove to be very useful in the Kitchen's elevator. I mustn't trigger the alarms...)

Level 6, "The House": The Kitchen.
- Man, I told you I just pecked an itsy-bitsy... I was outside collecting butterflies and suddenly this dazzling aroma of codfish with creams...

Level 6, "The House": The secret passage.
Behind that vase with a huge plant there's a hidden passage to the basement.

Level 6, "The House": Switch On.
Don't venture yourself in the dark, although you're a "Shadow Warrior".

Level 6, "The House": Traps.
A maze of wired traps.

Level 6, "The House": Steam.
A ninja with vapours is called a steamed ninja.
Level 6, "The House": Run.

Showdown: Kunitoki is trespassed.
It's preferable not to lay down your weapons yet, not before every or almost every Oil lamp has been set alight.

The end.
The last of lamps is alight. Kunitoki is not capable of re-spawning himself again. Well, at least not until the "Last Ninja 3".
